{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of fevers, headaches, myalgias, arthralgias, and a pruritic maculopapular rash, along with the history of travel to Brazil, suggest a viral infection. The fact that the symptoms resolved without any medications further supports a viral etiology. Given the recent concern about Zika virus in Brazil and its association with microcephaly, Zika virus is the most likely etiologic agent in this case.", "answer_choice": "D. Zika virus"}
